detailedRequirements:
HP IDOL OnDemand is a complete solution for bringing extensive data analytics to your cloud- or mobile-app and for augmenting your Big Data solution using REST APIs.

Through our Early Access program, we’re exposing the capabilities of HP IDOL (Intelligent Data Operating Layer), the world’s leading on-premise human information processing engine, as a managed solution to deliver a broad selection of web services to developers.

The true power of IDOL OnDemand is evident when you start to combine the APIs. Consume IDOL OnDemand Indexing APIs to index your unstructured data from social media, mobile devices, CMS, Google docs, Dropbox, email, SharePoint or other sources. Once indexed, analyze and augment your content, using IDOL OnDemand APIs such as OCR, Sentiment Analysis, Extract Entity, Face Detection, Barcode Recognition and Text Extraction. Finally, leverage IDOL OnDemand Search APIs to find what you need and shine light on dark data with advanced search options such as Find Similar, Query Text Index, Find Facets, Clusters or Terms.

http://www.idolondemand.com

New HP IDOL OnDemand challenges launched weekly! Check http://idolondemand.topcoder.com for a complete list of HP IDOL OnDemand topcoder challenges.

HP IDOL OnDemand Force.com Library

As part of the development effort for our Case Search and Index application  we've assembled a fairly extensive library of IDOL OnDemand functions which can be found in our IDOLAPI class.  We've also developed very accessible code (HTTPClient class) to perform JSON processing from SFDC.  In this challenge, we're hoping to repackage these capabilities into a readily consumable form for developers.  Here are the tasks for this challenge:

1.  Develop a unmanaged code package which contains the IDOLApi and HTTPClient classes and the other classes required support the basic functionality to make IDOL API REST requests and parse responses.  You should include Utility classes as required in the library but some classes may need to be refactored to remove Case-specific functionality.  No controller classes or VF pages should be included in our final product.  You're creating a IDOL OnDemand library here for other Force.com developers to use.
2.  Create test class and methods which validate the functionality of each IDOLApi function.  All your tests should not only pass but make actual API calls to IDOL OnDemand.  
3.  Remove the dependency that the current Case Indexer Package has on Email to Case being enabled.  You should also remove the dependency that the code requires a Case Recordtype.  Those restrictions aren't appropriate for a more generalized library.
4.  You are required to add additional IDOL API functions to the existing list but we have some methods in our library which aren't currently functional which involve getting multipart post REST functionality enabled.  Those methods are storeObject, expandContainer, and textExtraction.  Getting those functions working is a requirement for this challenge.  When you fix this, you can claim a bonus by entering your solution into the targetted F2F challenge related to this issue.
5. Wherever possible please reduce duplication in the code to produce clean readable code.  For example, the code which post files through multipart post should be extracted into a common code unit and abstracted from API calls themselves.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Detailed requirements are outlined in the attached requirements document.

1. You should use Visualforce and Apex.  You will not need all the previously provided code provided in the Case Index and Search application.  You are creating an API interface for other developers to use.

2. You may use Bootstrap and/or JQuery javascript libraries. 

3. Provide a video of your submission in action. 

4. Provide detailed documentation of your solution.

5. Please provide your submission as an unmanaged package for evaluation

6. Please use the previous provided code as a starting point for your submission:  https://login.salesforce.com/packaging/installPackage.apexp?p0=04t90000000VGw3

Installation of Case Search and Index Codebase

  1. In your target developer org you’ll need enable Email to Case so that the Case Indexer can review and load your case emails to the IDOL OnDemand Text Index.  Note that in your final package produced for this challenge, you'll need to remove this dependency.
  2. You’ll also need to create at least one Case Record Type in your developer organization.  Note that in your final package produced for this challenge, you'll need to remove this dependency.
  3. Install the code at the following package installer link: 

https://login.salesforce.com/packaging/installPackage.apexp?p0=04t90000000VGw3

Employees and direct and indirect subcontractors of Hewlett-Packard Company and its subsidiaries and other affiliates (“HP”), and employees and direct and indirect subcontractors of HP’s partners (including TopCoder and its affiliates) are not eligible to participate in the challenge.
